title: Are There Calories in Vapes?
meta_description: Discover if there are calories in vapes, including nutritional breakdown per puff or session, assumptions, and related facts for health-conscious users.
assumptions: Standard e-cigarette vape session (one puff or typical use); includes e-liquid with PG/VG base, nicotine, and flavors; inhaled vapor, not ingested.
disclaimer: Vaping is not a dietary activity; any caloric content from e-liquids is negligible when inhaled and not absorbed like food. Values vary by device, liquid composition, and usage; consult health experts.

quick_answer.text: Vapes contain no significant calories as the vapor is inhaled, not consumed.

label_note: Values reflect negligible nutritional impact from inhalation; mirrors zero Nutrition Facts for non-digestible vapors.

tweaks.label: Sweetened flavor e-liquid (e.g., fruit or dessert)

faqs.a: No, vapes have zero calories since the vapor is inhaled and not metabolized like food.
Flavors may contain trace sugars, but inhalation means no caloric absorption occurs.

faqs.q: What about e-liquid ingredients and nutrition?
faqs.a: E-liquids have PG/VG bases with minimal calories per ml, but vaping doesn't count as ingestion.

faqs.q: Can vaping affect weight or diet?
faqs.a: Vaping itself has no calories, but nicotine may suppress appetite; it's not a weight management tool.

faqs.q: How many calories in a full vape pod?
faqs.a: Still zero effective calories, as the liquid is vaporized and inhaled, not swallowed.
